isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Manifolds and Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) - Removal - Intake Manifold and EGR Cooler Assembly

svcproc.title: Intake Manifold and EGR Cooler Assembly

step1.para: Remove the turbocharger air intake duct, oil supply line, exhaust tube assembly, and dual turbocharger assembly. See "Dual Stage Turbocharger Assembly".
Remove the secondary fuel filter assembly. See "Fuel Systems".
Remove the oil filter housing assembly. See "Oil Cooler and Filter Housing".

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, blow out or vacuum any dirt and debris from around and under the intake manifold. This minimizes the chances something could fall in the cylinder head intake ports.

step1.para: If required, remove M6 x 25 x 25 stud bolt, five M6 x 25 bolts, intake elbow and gasket.
Vacuum or blow out dirt and debris from around the intake manifold.
Remove two M6 x 80 x 10 stud bolts and ten M6 x 80 bolts.
Loosen two EGR coolant hose clamps.

note.para: The EGR cooler should remain attached to the intake manifold.

step1.para: Lift intake manifold and EGR cooler assembly up and off engine.
Carefully remove dirt and debris from around mating surfaces of intake ports, making sure debris does not fall into intake ports.
Use a borescope to inspect the inside of intake ports. Remove objects and debris from intake ports. Use a magnet to remove metal objects or fragments.

Install Magnetic Covers for Cylinder Head Intake Ports
.
Remove and discard the front cover O-ring seal.
